metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29130 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
slirp.c in libslirp through 4.3.1 has a buffer over-read because it tries to read a certain amount of header data even if that exceeds the total packet length.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29130` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libslirp0 - 4.4.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libslirp package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1').
